alert.note: Alert for Central Oahu; Ewa Plain; Koolau Leeward; Koolau Windward; Oahu North Shore; Olomana; Waianae Coast; Waianae Mountains (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 19 at 9:54AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Oahu in Honolulu County through 1015 AM HST... At 952 AM HST, Doppler radar was tracking a line of strong thunderstorms extending across Oahu from near Kahuku and Laie, across central Oahu near Schofield Barracks, to the west side of Oahu near Waianae and Maili. This line of very strong storms was moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Hauula, Mililani, Wahiawa, Waialua, Schofield Barracks, Kaneohe Marine Base, Kahaluu, Ahuimanu, Punaluu, Waianae, Kunia, Wheeler Field, Kapolei, Waikele, Waikane, Waiahole, Aiea, Nanakuli. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 PM HST for Hawaii.
